article: When I was a child, my mom liked to prepare food for dinner, every now and then. And I remember one night in _ when she made dinner after a long, hard day at work. That Monday evening so long ago, my mom _ a plate of eggs, sausage, and extremely burnt toast in front of my dad. I remember _ to see if dad noticed! _ all my dad did was reach for his toast, smile at my mom, and ask me how my day was at school . I don't remember what I told him that night, but I do remember watching him _ butter and jelly on that toast and eat every _ ! When I got up from the _ that evening, I remember hearing my mom _ to my dad for burning the toast. And I'll never forget what he said: "Baby, I love _ toast." Later that night, I went to kiss Daddy goodnight and I asked him if he _ liked his burnt toast. He surrounded me in his arms and said, "Son, your mum put in a _ day at work today and she's very _ . Besides, a little burnt toast never _ anyone!" Actually, life is full of imperfect things and imperfect people. We can't be _ at everything we do. What I've learned over the years is that learning to _ each other's faults and choosing to celebrate each other's _ is one of the most important keys to creating a healthy, growing, and lasting _ . If you learn to take the good, the bad, and the ugly parts of your life as they are, you can _ your life to the fullest.
